intro: Oncoba fragrans, commonly known as the sweetshrub, is a deciduous shrub native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Oleaceae and is characterized by its fragrant, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has opposite, simple, ovate leaves with serrated margins, and its bark is smooth and grayish-brown. Oncoba fragrans produces small, woody fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It is often used in ornamental gardening due to its pleasant scent and attractive foliage.
